intro: Psychotria pubifolia, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow and are clustered in dense inflorescences. Psychotria pubifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
